unnormalised: Entertainment News: Streaming Giants in Desi Drama!
normalised: Entertainment News: Streaming Giants in Desi Drama!

unnormalised: Mumbai – Is your data pack crying in a corner because you’re binging Bollywood remixes at 3 AM? Well, you're not alone! The music streaming wars in India are heating up faster than a tawa at a Punjabi wedding.
normalised: Mumbai – Is your data pack crying in a corner because you’re binging Bollywood remixes at three A M? Well, you're not alone! The music streaming wars in India are heating up faster than a tawa at a Punjabi wedding.

unnormalised: Spotify, Gaana, JioSaavn, and even Amazon Music are all vying for your precious ears and your even more precious rupees. Experts at IIT-Delhi are reportedly developing an algorithm to predict which Honey Singh song will go viral next. Good luck with that, guys!
normalised: Spotify, Gaana, JioSaavn, and even Amazon Music are all vying for your precious ears and your even more precious rupees. Experts at I I T-Delhi are reportedly developing an algorithm to predict which Honey Singh song will go viral next. Good luck with that, guys!

unnormalised: Rumor has it, T-Series is considering launching its own streaming platform, tentatively titled “Dildaar Downloads.” Imagine the drama! Will they offer a Karan Johar curated playlist? Will they finally explain the plot of *Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham*?
normalised: Rumor has it, T-Series is considering launching its own streaming platform, tentatively titled “Dildaar Downloads.” Imagine the drama! Will they offer a Karan Johar curated playlist? Will they finally explain the plot of *Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham*?

unnormalised: One thing's for sure: with millions of potential subscribers humming along, the streaming scene is set to be a non-stop dance party. Just remember to put on your headphones so your neighbour, Sharmaji, doesn’t file a noise complaint.
normalised: One thing's for sure: with millions of potential subscribers humming along, the streaming scene is set to be a non-stop dance party. Just remember to put on your headphones so your neighbour, Sharmaji, doesn’t file a noise complaint.
